trans-unit.note: The URL of a page with basic information about '''bees''', on the most appropriate linguistic edition of Wikipedia for the target language.\nMake sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.

trans-unit.source: Make the legs reverse direction half way through the movie.
Stop the program and reset the level.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Pressing this button restores the player to the start position and enables the user's program to be run again.

The URL of a page with basic information about '''ducks''', on the most appropriate linguistic edition of Wikipedia for the target language.\nMake sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.

trans-unit.source: The highlighted block is not correct.\nKeep trying.
trans-unit.note: A message indicating that a visually distinguished block is incorrect and that the user should try to fix it.\n\nThe use of a new line character is optional.
block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb to lift up a pen so that moving it leaves no mark on the writing surface.
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Genetics''' game.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Genetics{rb}{rb}
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Movie''' game.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Movie{rb}{rb}
block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb to lower a raised pen so that moving it leaves a mark on the writing surface.
button label - Pressing this button shows help information.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Help{rb}{rb}
Tooltip for the button that opens the language reference documentation.

trans-unit.source: Submit your movie to the gallery.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Pressing this button causes the movie created by the user's program to be submitted to a gallery for other people to see.

trans-unit.source: A 'function' allows you to group blocks together, then run them more than once.
trans-unit.note: Introducing a new block: function or subroutines

{lb}{lb}Optional{rb}{rb} The URL of a page with basic information about '''printing''' or '''typography'''.\nMake sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.
category - Blocks related to [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subroutine defining or using procedures/functions].\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Functions{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Moves the turtle forward or backward by the specified amount.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - In this and subsequent messages, 'turtle' refers to a stylized turtle on the screen to represent a position and direction. This imaginary turtle is carrying a pen in its tail, so moving the turtle draws a line (or curve, etc.). You are encouraged to play with the [https://blockly-demo.appspot.com/static/apps/turtle/index.html Turtle application] before doing this translation.

trans-unit.source: Give the person a couple of hands.
trans-unit.note: Instructions. Drawing hands on a picture of a person.
block text - the compass direction toward which a traveler or vehicle is or should be moving; course.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Heading{rb}{rb}
Label on a tab that contains blocks editor.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Block{rb}{rb}
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Bird''' game.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Bird{rb}{rb}
Example name of a function that plays the first part of some music.
tooltip - Pressing this button opens a gallery of music made by other users.

trans-unit.source: Lifts or lowers the pen, to stop or start drawing.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Lifting the pen off the writing surface prevents anything from being drawn. Lowering it (after it has been lifted) enables it to draw again.
Label on a button that submits the user's art to a public gallery.

[[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Infinitive or imperative of a verb telling a turtle to move (walk) in the direction he/she is facing. This is followed by a number indicating how far (how many pixels) to go. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'move backward'. See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].

trans-unit.source: Switches to the specified instrument when playing subsequent musical notes.

trans-unit.note: button label - Pressing this button causes the output of the program to be erased but does not delete the user's program).\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Reset{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Your solution works, but you can do better.
trans-unit.note: Dialog telling user to seek a better answer.
Label for a rectangle's height input.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Height{rb}{rb}
block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb telling a turtle to hide itself (become invisible).

trans-unit.source: Create a second function for the next part of 'Frère Jacques'. The last note is longer.
Submit your drawing to the gallery.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Pressing this button causes the drawing created by the user's program to be submitted to a gallery for other people to see.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the enclosed actions until finish point is reached.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Repeat the enclosed commands until the maze has been successfully completed (the end point reached).
Label for a circle's radius input.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Radius{rb}{rb}
Text on button for deleting all the user's data.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Clear data{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Change the heading angle to make the bird get the worm and land in her nest.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown as instruction for the first level.

trans-unit.source: Once you start editing JavaScript, you can't go back to editing blocks. Is this OK?

trans-unit.note: title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Turtle''' game.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Turtle{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Changes the width of the pen.

trans-unit.note: Name for a player that does nothing.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Target{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Click on %1 in the 'if' block to change its condition.
trans-unit.note: callout - %1 will be replaced with an image of the dropdown menu that the user needs to click.
Prompt for a couple of traits of an animal (e.g. Duck: feathers, beak).\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Trait{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Your solution works, but you can do better. Use functions to reduce the amount of repeated code.
trans-unit.note: Dialog telling user to seek a better answer.

trans-unit.source: Are you ready for the next challenge?
trans-unit.note: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the most difficult level and is going to go to the next game.

trans-unit.source: As the movie plays, the value of the 'time' block counts from 0 to 100. Since you want the 'y' position of the arm to start at 0 and go to 100 this should be easy.
trans-unit.note: Instructions. Do not translate the word 'time' or the name 'y'.
Fur: A trait that cats have.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Fur{rb}{rb}
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Maze''' game.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Maze{rb}{rb}

Plays one musical note. %1 is duration of the note (whole, quarter, ...), %2 is the pitch of the note (A, B, C, ...).

''FIXME''' :
* Where are the translation for 'whole note', 'quarter note' (note: this cannot be split with the common term for 'note', the adjectives for 'whole' or 'half' may combine differently or both may combine to a single and distinctive term), so '%1 note' should become just '%1' after fixing the code and adding new translation units.
* The pitches (A, B, C, ...) are also language dependant (C=do/ut, D=re, ... G=sol, A=la, B=si) and should be translatable too.
Generic name for the player of this video game.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Player{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: You solved this level with %1 lines of JavaScript:
trans-unit.note: alert - Displayed when a level is complete. %1 is an integer greater than 1.

trans-unit.source: Instead of one star, can you draw four stars arranged in a square?
Move in the direction of the given angle: 0 is to the right, 90 is straight up, etc.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Move in the direction of the given angle, where 0 means going horizontally to the right, and 90 straight up and 270 straight down.
warning - No more blocks may be added until some are removed. Please include '%0' in the translated string. It will be replaced with '0' and made bold.
Slime: A trait that snails have.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Slime{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Choose a category to see the blocks.
trans-unit.note: Instructions for accessing blocks that are hidden inside categories.
button label - Pressing this button cancels a proposed action.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Cancel{rb}{rb}

variable name - Default [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Variables variable] representing a [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Lists list]. This should be a single word, preferably short.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|List{rb}{rb}
alert - This is displayed when the user solves the level.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Congratulation{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Makes the player do what the blocks say.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Pressing this button runs the computer program the user has written to move the player through the maze.
[[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Condensed form of 'if there is a path to the left', as in: 'if path to the left, turn left'.
tooltip - Pressing this button opens a gallery of drawings made by other users.

trans-unit.source: Your movie doesn't move. Use blocks to make something interesting. Then you may submit your movie to the gallery.
Changes the colour of the pen.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Changes the colour of ink in the pen carried by the turtle.

trans-unit.source: Draws a rectangle at the specified location and with the specified width and height.
Draws a circle at the specified location and with the specified radius.
Plays one musical note of the specified duration and pitch.
Can you add a black circle so that the moon becomes a crescent?
Draws a line from one point to another with the specified width.

trans-unit.note: Label for the y-coordinate of the start of a line

A congratulatory message displayed if the user placed all of the blocks correctly.

Parameters:
* %1 - number of blocks correctly placed. It is always an integer greater than 1.

The use of a new line character is optional.

block text - This precedes a number specifying the size of the typographic font that should be used when displaying text. This appears in the same block as 'font', so that word should not be repeated.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Font size{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Change your program to draw a pentagon instead of a square.

trans-unit.note: block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb to specify the colour of the lines that should be drawn in the future by an imaginary pen. This is followed by a block showing the colour
[[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Specifies that a typographic font should be [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emphasis_(typography) bold].
Label on a button that opens a gallery of music made by other users.
Initial text displayed in a dropdown menu from which the user should choose an option.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Choose{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Compose the first four notes of 'Frère Jacques'.
trans-unit.note: Instructions. If your country has a song to the tune of 'Frère Jacques' use its name. E.g. Bruder Jakob (German) or Kìa con bướm (Vietnamese).

[[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Imperative or infinitive of a verb for a person turning his head and body one quarter rotation clockwise. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn left'. See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].

trans-unit.source: This target needs to be hit many times. Use a 'while (true)' loop to do something indefinitely.

trans-unit.note: A label on a button the user can press to check his/her answers.

trans-unit.source: Play your tune with a violin.
Move the background circle to the top of your program. Then it will appear behind the person.
trans-unit.note: Dialog telling user to change the order of their program.

trans-unit.source: Returns the current speed of the player (0 is stopped, 100 is full speed).
trans-unit.note: Tooltip for the block that reports the player's speed.
[[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Specifies that a typographic font should be normal (neither in italics or bold).

trans-unit.source: Put the player back at the start of the maze.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Pressing this button restores the player to the start position and enables the user's program to be run again.

trans-unit.source: Use the 'cannon' command to hit the target. The first parameter is the angle, the second parameter is the range. Find the right combination.
trans-unit.note: Instructions. Do not translate the word 'cannon'.

trans-unit.source: Use the "See Gallery" button to see what other people have drawn. If you draw something interesting, use the "Submit to Gallery" button to publish it.

trans-unit.note: The URL of a page with basic information about '''snails''', on the most appropriate linguistic edition of Wikipedia for the target language.\nMake sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.

[[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Condensed form of 'if there is a path ahead', as in: 'if path ahead, go forward'. Prefer translation that has text in common with 'if path to the left' and 'if path to the right'.

trans-unit.source: Each start block should play 'Frère Jacques' twice.
The 'time' block counts from 0 to 100. But now you want the 'y' position of the other arm to start at 100 and go to 0. Can you figure out a simple mathematical formula that flips the direction?
trans-unit.note: Instructions. Do not translate the word 'time' or the name 'y'.

trans-unit.source: The 'and' block is true only if both its inputs are true.
Create four start blocks that each play 'Frère Jacques' twice. Add the correct number of delay blocks.

trans-unit.note: Shell: A trait that snails have.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Shell{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: You can fit more than one block inside a 'repeat' block.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is a hint that the user should place a second block inside of a a 'repeat' block.

trans-unit.source: Use this block to go in one heading if you have the worm, or a different heading if you don't have the worm.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown when the 'does not have worm' block is introduced.
Tooltip for the block that allows players to move.

trans-unit.source: Complete the full tune of 'Frère Jacques'.
Prints a number to your browser's console.
trans-unit.note: Tooltip for the block that prints debugging information.
tooltip - Pressing this button opens a gallery of movies made by other users.

trans-unit.source: Can you solve this complicated maze? Try following the left-hand wall. Advanced programmers only!
trans-unit.note: callout - This advises the user to solve a maze by keeping his/her left hand in contact with the wall while proceeding through it. The final sentence is a warning that only advanced programmers should attempt this problem, as beginners tend to get frustrated.

trans-unit.source: Thank you for this program! If our staff of trained monkeys like it, they will publish it to the gallery within a couple of days.
trans-unit.note: alert - After the user has submitted his/her program to the gallery, it must wait for approval. Please make this message funny!
Name for a player that moves back and forth.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Pendulum{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Returns the current time in the animation (0-100).

trans-unit.note: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Specifies that a typographic font should be [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italics italic].
Feathers: A trait that ducks have.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Feather{rb}{rb}

title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Pond Tutor''' game. It is a series of lessons or practice levels to allow users to play the more advanced '''Pond''' game (in your language: '''{lb}{lb}:Blockly:Games.pond/{lb}{lb}RelevantLanguage{rb}{rb}{rb}{rb}''').

trans-unit.source: You have used up all the blocks for this level. To create a new block, you first need to delete an existing block.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown after the user has used all the blocks permitted on this level.

trans-unit.source: 'x' is your current horizontal position. Use this block to go in one heading if 'x' is less than a number, or a different heading otherwise.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown when the 'x smaller than 50' block is introduced.

trans-unit.source: Use simple shapes to draw this person.

trans-unit.note: Text on the button that opens the language reference documentation.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Documentation{rb}{rb}
block text - This precedes a dropdown menu specifying the typographic font [family] that should be used when displaying text.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Font{rb}{rb}
block text - Imperative or infinitive of a verb for a person moving (walking) in the direction he/she is facing.
Name for a player that is scared.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Scared{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Draw three yellow stars, and one white line.

trans-unit.note: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the level, inviting them to procede to the next level of difficulty. %1 is an integer greater than 1.

trans-unit.source: Draw the star with just four blocks.
trans-unit.note: Dialog telling user to seek a simpler answer.
Label in front of a field where the user is requested to type a title for their work.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Title{rb}{rb}
Label for a rectangle or line's width input.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Width{rb}{rb}
tooltip - Pressing this button will cause the current program to be saved and for a URL to be shown to later retrieve it.

trans-unit.source: Create a function to play the first four notes of 'Frère Jacques'. Run that function twice. Don't add any new note blocks.

trans-unit.note: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Infinitive or imperative of a verb telling a turtle to move (walk) in the direction opposite to where he/she is facing. This is followed by a number indicating how far (how many pixels) to go. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'move forward'.

variable name - Default [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Variables variable] representing a [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Text piece of text]. This should be a single word, preferably short.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Text{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Stack a couple of 'move forward' blocks together to help me reach the goal.
trans-unit.note: callout - The word words for 'stack' and 'blocks' should be the same as for stacking children's blocks. Use the imperative verb form appropriate for speaking to a child, gender unspecified. If no gender-neutral singular/familiar form exists but a gender-neutral plural/formal form exists, use that instead. Be sure to use the same translation of 'move forward' as above.

trans-unit.source: Sets the font used by the print block.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - This is shown on the block that lets the user specify the font [family], size, and style that should be used for subsequent displays of text.

trans-unit.source: This opponent is also too far away to use the cannon. But you are too weak to survive a collision. Swim towards the opponent while your horizontal location is less than than 50. Then 'stop' and use the cannon.
trans-unit.note: Instructions. Do not translate the word 'stop'.

trans-unit.source: Turns the player left or right by 90 degrees.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Turns the icon on the screen representing the player 90 degrees counter-clockwise (left) or clockwise (right).

trans-unit.source: Use the "See Gallery" button to see what other people have composed. If you compose something interesting, use the "Submit to Gallery" button to publish it.
Your program didn't solve the maze. Press 'Reset' and try again.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown after the user has run a program that does not solve the maze.

trans-unit.source: Moves the player forward one space.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Moves the icon on the screen representing the player forward one square on the maze board.

trans-unit.source: Run your program to see what happens.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown after the user has created a program on the first level.

trans-unit.source: There's a new block that allows you to change the colour:
Your solution works, but you can do better. Use 'scan' to tell the cannon how far to shoot.
trans-unit.note: Dialog telling user to seek a better answer. Do not translate the word 'scan'.

trans-unit.source: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do some actions.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.
Label on a button that opens a gallery of movies made by other users.

trans-unit.source: Create a program that draws a square.
The mathematical formula for the arm is complicated. Here's the answer:

trans-unit.note: Label for the y-coordinate of the end of a line.
block text - Imperative or infinitive of a verb to repeat the following commands. The phrase is followed by the symbol denoting the end of the maze.
tooltip - Describes a musical note selector. 'C4' (also known as 'DO') is the note in the center of a piano keyboard and is represented as the number 7.
Label on a button that opens a gallery of drawings made by other users.

trans-unit.source: Scan for enemies. Specify a direction (0-360). Returns the distance to the closest enemy in that direction. Returns Infinity if no enemy found.
trans-unit.note: Tooltip for the block that allows players to scan for enemies.

trans-unit.source: Returns the Y coordinate of the player (0 is the bottom edge, 100 is the top edge).
trans-unit.note: Tooltip for the block that reports the player's vertical location.

trans-unit.source: Could not load your saved file. Perhaps it was created with a different version of Blockly?
trans-unit.note: alert - There was a problem loading a file previously saved by the user. The most likely reason for the problem is that it was created with an earlier, incompatible version of Blockly. This message will be followed by technical information useful to engineers trying to understand the problem.

trans-unit.source: You solved this level with 1 line of JavaScript:
trans-unit.note: alert - Displayed when a level is complete.

trans-unit.source: On this level, you need to stack together all of the blocks in the white workspace.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is displayed if a user attempts to run a program composed of multiple stacks of blocks, letting them know they need to create a single stack.
Prompt for the number of legs that an animal has.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Leg{rb}{rb}
button label - Pressing this button runs the computer program the user has written.

trans-unit.source: This level is extremely difficult. Would you like to skip it and go onto the next game? You can always come back later.
trans-unit.note: callout - This dialog gives the user the option to skip this level.

trans-unit.source: Run your program until it stops. Then you may submit your music to the gallery.
Choose your favourite player from this menu.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is a hint that the user can change the appearance of the player that moves within the maze.

{lb}{lb}Optional{rb}{rb} The URL of a page with basic information about '''typographic fonts'''.\nMake sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.

trans-unit.source: Sorry, '%1' doesn't correspond with any saved program.
trans-unit.note: alert - A request to retrieve a stored program does not have a valid URL. %1 is the invalid portion of the URL.

trans-unit.source: Use what you learned in the previous level to make legs that cross.

trans-unit.note: Label for the x-coordinate of the end of a line.
block text - Bird is not in possession of a worm. This phrase is prefixed with 'if'.

trans-unit.source: Draw an expanding circle behind the person.

trans-unit.note: Honey: A trait that bees have.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Honey{rb}{rb}

block text - Imperative or infinitive of a verb preceding one or more commands to a person. This is part of [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Loops#repeat repeat] and [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/IfElse#If_blocks if] blocks.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Do{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Draw a small yellow star, then draw a line above it.
For each animal (green), attach its picture, choose its number of legs, and make a stack of its traits.
trans-unit.note: Instructions for the puzzle. For context, see [https://blockly.games/puzzle Blockly Puzzle].

[[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Infinitive or imperative of verb telling a turtle to rotate counter-clockwise (anti-clockwise). This is followed by a number indicating how far (how many degrees) to turn. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn right by'.

[[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Imperative or infinitive of a verb for a person turning his head and body one quarter rotation counter-clockwise. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn right'. See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].
The program associated with this label is executed when a button is clicked. %1 is image of the play icon on the button.
Plays no music for a duration specified. %1 is the duration (whole, quarter, ...).

trans-unit.source: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do the first block of actions. Otherwise, do the second block of actions.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.

trans-unit.source: Draws text in the turtle's direction at its location.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Note that 'print' refers to displaying text on the screen, not on an external printer.

The URL of a page with basic information about '''cats''', on the most appropriate linguistic edition of Wikipedia for the target language.\nMake sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.

trans-unit.source: Run your program until it stops. Then you may submit your drawing to the gallery.
Returns the player's current health (0 is dead, 100 is healthy).
trans-unit.note: Tooltip for the block that reports the player's health.

trans-unit.source: This opponent is too far away to use the cannon (which has a limit of 70 meters). Instead, use the 'swim' command to start swimming towards the opponent and crash into it.
trans-unit.note: Instructions. Do not translate the word 'swim'.

trans-unit.source: Share your blocks with this link:\n\n%1
trans-unit.note:
alert - After the user has pressed a button to save his/her program, this provides the URL (%1) to retrieve the program. The characters '

' indicate that a blank line will be displayed before the URL (in English). Leave those in unless you move %1 to the beginning or middle of the text, in which case you should use your judgment about where blank lines would be most useful.

Parameters:
* %1 - URL of saved program.
Display of art created by user's programs.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Gallery{rb}{rb}
Link to a description of Blockly Games, intended for parents and teachers.

trans-unit.source: Click the icon to modify the 'if' block.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown when the user first needs to modify an 'if' block.
Label for the x-coordinate of the start of a line.

trans-unit.source: An 'if' block will do something only if the condition is true. Try turning left if there is a path to the left.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown when the 'if' block is introduced. An example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.

trans-unit.source: This opponent will move away when it is hit. Swim towards it if it is out of range (70 meters).
Draw anything you want. You've got a huge number of new blocks you can explore. Have fun!
Draw the stars, then draw four white lines.

trans-unit.note: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Infinitive or imperative of verb telling a turtle to rotate clockwise. This is followed by a number indicating how far (how many degrees) to turn. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn left by'.

trans-unit.source: Drag an 'else' block into the 'if' block.
Stop swimming. Player will slow to a stop.
trans-unit.note: Tooltip for the block that allows players to stop.

trans-unit.source: Make a movie of anything you want. You've got a huge number of new blocks you can explore. Have fun!
Draw the shape with just three blocks.
trans-unit.note: Dialog telling user to seek a simpler answer.

trans-unit.source: x and y mark the bird's position. When x = 0 the bird is near the left edge, when x = 100 it's near the right edge. When y = 0 the bird is at the bottom, when y = 100 it's at the top.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - (x, y) marks the coordinate of bird, (0, 0) is the bottom left corner and (100, 100) top right.
Beak: A trait that ducks have.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Beak{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Turns the turtle left or right by the specified number of degrees.
Returns the X coordinate of the player (0 is the left edge, 100 is the right edge).
trans-unit.note: Tooltip for the block that reports the player's horizontal location.

An error message displayed if the user misplaced multiple blocks.

Parameters:
* %1 - number of blocks incorrectly placed, which is always greater than 1 (or the message Puzzle.error1 would be used).

trans-unit.source: This new block adds a silent delay.
trans-unit.note: Introducing a new block: a musical rest.
tooltip - Pressing this button runs the computer program the user has written.
button label - Pressing this button closes help information.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|OK{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Changes the colour of the pen.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Changes the colour of ink in the pen carried by the turtle.
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Puzzle''' game. Use the word for a jigsaw puzzle.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Puzzle{rb}{rb}
Whiskers: A trait that cats have.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Whisker{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Create a third function for the next part of 'Frère Jacques'. The first four notes are shorter.
This range is exactly what the 'cannon' command needs to fire accurately.

trans-unit.note: Label on a button that submits the user's art to a public gallery.
Prompt for a picture of an animal.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Picture{rb}{rb}
Confirmation prompt for deleting all the user's data.

trans-unit.source: Submit your music to the gallery.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Pressing this button causes the music created by the user's program to be submitted to a gallery for other people to see.

trans-unit.source: There was a problem with the request.
trans-unit.note: alert - The URL is invalid or a server error occurred. This message will be followed by technical information useful to engineers trying to understand the problem.

trans-unit.source: Makes the turtle (circle and arrow) visible or invisible.
The music will sound better if you use a different instrument in each start block.
trans-unit.note: Dialog telling user not to use only one musical instrument (piano, flute, etc).

trans-unit.source: Create a second start block that has two delay blocks, then also plays 'Frère Jacques'.

trans-unit.note: Stinger: A trait that bees have.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Stinger{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Compose anything you want. You've got a huge number of new blocks you can explore. Have fun!

trans-unit.note: Sets to an instrument to play music. %1 is type of the instrument (guitar, piano, ...).

trans-unit.source: Fire the cannon. Specify a direction (0-360) and a range (0-70).
trans-unit.note: Tooltip for the block that allows players to shoot at other players.

trans-unit.source: Use the 'if' block to draw a small head for the first half of the movie. Then draw a big head for the second half of the movie.
Drawing 360 white lines will look like the full moon.
This level needs both an 'else if' and an 'else' block.
Reach the end of this path using only two blocks. Use 'repeat' to run a block more than once.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown when the 'repeat' block is introduced. The word 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.
An encouraging error message displayed if the user placed all blocks except 1 correctly.\n\nIf the number of incorrect blocks is 2 or more, Puzzle.error2 is used instead.

block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb to set the width of the lines that should be drawn in the future by an imaginary pen. This is followed by a number indicating the width in pixels (1 or greater).
[[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Condensed form of 'if there is a path to the right', as in: 'if path to the right, turn right'.
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Pond''' game.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Pond{rb}{rb}
Label on a button that submits the user's movie to a public gallery.
block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb telling a turtle to show itself (become visible after having been invisible).

trans-unit.source: If-else blocks will do one thing or the other.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown when the 'if-else' block is introduced. For 'if-else' concatenate the words for 'if' and 'else/otherwise'.

trans-unit.source: This new block lets you change to another instrument.
trans-unit.note: Introducing a new block that changes musical instruments.
block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb telling a turtle to display text on the screen. This is always followed by a block indicating what should be printed.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Print{rb}{rb}
Label next to button for deleting all the user's data.

trans-unit.source: There's a new block that allows you to lift your pen off the paper when you move:
Executes the blocks inside when the 'Run Program' button is clicked.
Use the "See Gallery" button to see movies that other people have made. If you make an interesting movie, use the "Submit to Gallery" button to publish it.
The condition when the bird has not gotten the worm.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - The bird wants to get the worm.

trans-unit.source: This level is a movie. You want the person's arm to move across the screen. Press the play button to see a preview.
trans-unit.note: Instructions. The play button looks like the video play button on YouTube.

trans-unit.source: This opponent moves back and forth, making it hard to hit. The 'scan' expression returns the exact range to the opponent in the specified direction.

trans-unit.note: block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb to specify the colour of the lines that should be drawn in the future by an imaginary pen. This is followed by a block showing the colour

block text - Conjunction meaning 'otherwise', introducing commands to be performed if a previous condition was not true, as in 'if x>3, do this, else do that'. See [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/IfElse#If-Else_blocks].\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Else{rb}{rb}
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Music''' game.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Music{rb}{rb}
